intro: Serpicula, commonly known as the small liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its small, dense growth habit and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a thalloid structure, which consists of a flat, ribbon-like body that is often covered in tiny, leaf-like structures called phyllodes. Serpicula reproduces through spores, which are produced in specialized structures called sporangia located on the underside of its thallus. This plant plays an important role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
